org.sakaiproject.event.api

Interface UsageSessionService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SessionServiceAdaptorTest, UsageSessionServiceAdaptor

    public interface UsageSessionService

    UsageSessionService keeps track of usage sessions.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String EVENT_LOGIN
      Names for the events of logging in from well-known services.
      static String EVENT_LOGIN_CONTAINER 
      static String EVENT_LOGIN_DAV 
      static String EVENT_LOGIN_WS 
      static String EVENT_LOGOUT
      Name for the event of logging out.
      static String SAKAI_CSRF_SESSION_ATTRIBUTE
      Name for the CSRF token session attribute
      static String USAGE_SESSION_KEY
      Name for the session key to retrieve the UsageSession.

      • USAGE_SESSION_KEY

        static final String USAGE_SESSION_KEY
        Name for the session key to retrieve the UsageSession. Note: This must be a constant and not based on classname - it must stay the same regardless of the name of the implementing class.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • startSession

        UsageSession startSession(String userId,
                        String remoteAddress,
                        String userAgent)
        Establish a usage session associated with the current request or thread.
        Parameters:
        userId - The user id.
        remoteAddress - The IP address from the user is making a request.
        userAgent - The string describing the user's browser.
        Returns:
        The new UsageSession, or null if one could not be created.

      • getSession

        UsageSession getSession()
        Access the usage session associated with the current request or thread.
        Returns:
        The UsageSession object holding the information about this session.

      • getSessionId

        String getSessionId()
        Access the session id from the usage session associated with the current request or thread, or null if no session.
        Returns:
        The session id from the usage session associated with the current request or thread, or null if no session.

      • getSessionState

        SessionState getSessionState(String key)
        Access a SessionState object with the given key associated with the current usage session.
        Parameters:
        key - The SessionState key.
        Returns:
        an SessionState object with the given key.

      • getSession

        UsageSession getSession(String id)
        Access a usage session (may be other than the current one) by id.
        Parameters:
        id - the Session id.
        Returns:
        The UsageSession object for this id, or null if not defined.

      • getSessions

        List<UsageSession> getSessions(List<String> ids)
        Deprecated. not used will be removed in 1.3
        Access a List of usage sessions by List of ids.
        Parameters:
        ids - the List (String) of Session ids.
        Returns:
        The List (UsageSession) of UsageSession object for these ids.

      • getSessions

        List<UsageSession> getSessions(String joinTable,
                             String joinAlias,
                             String joinColumn,
                             String joinCriteria,
                             Object[] values)
        Access a List of usage sessions by *arbitrary criteria* for te session ids.
        Parameters:
        joinTable - the table name to (inner) join to
        joinAlias - the alias used in the criteria string for the joinTable
        joinColumn - the column name of the joinTable that is to match the session id in the join ON clause
        joinCriteria - the criteria of the select (after the where)
        values - Optional values to go with the criteria in an implementation specific way.
        Returns:
        The List (UsageSession) of UsageSession object for these ids.

      • getSessionInactiveTimeout

        int getSessionInactiveTimeout()
        Deprecated. not used will be removed in 1.3
        Access the time (seconds) we will wait for any user generated request from a session before we consider the session inactive.
        Returns:
        the time (seconds) used for session inactivity detection.

      • getSessionLostTimeout

        int getSessionLostTimeout()
        Deprecated. not used will be removed in 1.3
        Access the time (seconds) we will wait for hearing anyting from a session before we consider the session lost.
        Returns:
        the time (seconds) used for lost session detection.

      • getOpenSessions

        List<UsageSession> getOpenSessions()
        Deprecated. - not used will be removed in 1.3
        Access a list of all open sessions.
        Returns:
        a List (UsageSession) of all open sessions, ordered by server, then by start (asc)

      • getOpenSessionsByServer

        Map<String,UsageSession> getOpenSessionsByServer()
        Access a list of all open sessions, grouped by server.
        Returns:
        a Map (server id -> List (UsageSession)) of all open sessions, ordered by server, then by start (asc)

      • login

        boolean login(Authentication authn,
            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
        Start a usage session and do any other book-keeping needed to login a user who has already been authenticated.
        Parameters:
        authn - The user authentication.
        req - The servlet request.
        Returns:
        true if all went well, false if not (may fail if the userId is not a valid User)

      • login

        boolean login(Authentication authn,
            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
            String event)
        Start a usage session and do any other book-keeping needed to login a user who has already been authenticated. Use this method to specify a login event other than the default (e.g. WebDAV clients)
        Parameters:
        authn - The user authentication.
        req - The servlet request.
        event - The event code to post for this login.
        Returns:
        true if all went well, false if not (may fail if the userId is not a valid User)

      • login

        boolean login(String uid,
            String eid,
            String remoteaddr,
            String ua,
            String event)
        Start a usage session and do any other book-keeping needed to login a user who has already been authenticated. Use this method for logins that do not originate through the portal / request-filter (e.g. axis webservices) where an HttpServletRequest is not available.
        Parameters:
        uid - The user's uid
        eid - The user's eid
        remoteaddr - The IP address of the client
        ua - The client's user agent string
        event - The event code to post for this login.
        Returns:
        true if all went well, false if not (may fail if the userId is not a valid User)

      • logout

        void logout()
        End a usage session and otherwise cleanup from a login.

      • closeSessionsOnInvalidServers

        int closeSessionsOnInvalidServers(List<String> validServerIds)
        Close any orphaned usage session records left over after a server crash.
        Parameters:
        validServerIds - collection of server ID strings which are currently valid; an assumption is made that there will be fewer than 1000 active servers at any one time
        Returns:
        number of invalid sessions closed
